title: (No. 17 of 2012)) of the Local Government Services (Corporate Bodies) Act
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Housing and Sustainable
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Housing and Sustainable 

Communities Agency (Amendment) Order 2022. 

Amendment of Housing and Sustainable Communities Agency 
(Establishment) Order 2012
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited housing sustainable community agency (amendment) order 2022 amendment housing sustainable community agency (establishment) order 2012

title: (No. 17 of 2012)) of the Local Government Services (Corporate Bodies) Act
heading: 2. Article 6 of the Housing and Sustainable Communities Agency
text_raw:
2. Article 6 of the Housing and Sustainable Communities Agency 

(Establishment) Order 2012 (S.I. 264 of 2012) is amended - 

(a) 

(b) 

in paragraph (1), by the substitution of “eleven” for “nine”, and 

in paragraph (3)(g), by the substitution of “four” for “two”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 15th March, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [123] 3 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Order. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

2 March, 2022. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

3 March, 2022. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [123]

title: (No. 17 of 2012)) of the Local Government Services (Corporate Bodies) Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The purpose for which these Regulations are made under the Local 
Government Services (Corporate Bodies) Act 1971, is to amend the Housing 
and Sustainable Communities Agency (Establishment) Order 2012 to increase 
the membership of the Board of the Housing Agency from nine to eleven 
members, which would allow the Minister to appoint an additional two 
independent members. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [123] 5
